intro: Maripa reticulata var. rugosa, commonly known as the rough maripa, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rugose stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
